page.title: 08ABERTHIN VILLAGE_HISTORY
page.content: Aberthin is situated roughly one mile north of Cowbridge, in the parish of Llanblethian. it is set in a picturesque steep-sided valley to the north of Stalling Down . Aberthin is first mentioned in the book of Llandaff, where it is called "Ebirthum". Whether it was a monastic grange is however, open to speculation. When the Normans conquered Taly-farn, they created the sub-manor of Llanquian, and it is likely that Aberthin was the village of that sub-manor. One of the earliest Methodist societies in Wales was established at a farm house in the village in 1746. During the 18th century, Stalling Down was the venue of Cowbridge races. A greater crowd-puller than the races was the occasional hanging which took place on the downs.{( cont. P.9).}
